com.jswiff.swfrecords
Class MorphFillStyle

java.lang.Object
  com.jswiff.swfrecords.MorphFillStyle
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class MorphFillStyle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is used to define fill styles used in a morph sequence (as array within a DefineMorphShape tag. Three basic types of shape fills are available:

  • solid fill (with / without transparency)
  • gradient fill (linear / radial)
  • bitmap fill (clipped / tiled, smoothed / non-smoothed)

See Also:
MorphFillStyles, DefineMorphShape, FillStyle, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

MorphFillStyle

public MorphFillStyle(int bitmapId,
                      Matrix startBitmapMatrix,
                      Matrix endBitmapMatrix,
                      short type)
Creates a new bitmap morph fill style. You have to specify the character ID of a previously defined bitmap, two transform matrices used for mapping the bitmap to the filled (start and end) shapes, and the bitmap type (one of the constants TYPE_TILED_BITMAP, TYPE_CLIPPED_BITMAP, TYPE_NONSMOOTHED_TILED_BITMAP or TYPE_NONSMOOTHED_CLIPPED_BITMAP).

Parameters:
bitmapId - character ID of the bitmap
startBitmapMatrix - transform matrix for start state
endBitmapMatrix - transform matrix for end state
type - bitmap type
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an illegal bitmap type has been specified

MorphFillStyle

public MorphFillStyle(MorphGradient gradient,
                      Matrix startGradientMatrix,
                      Matrix endGradientMatrix,
                      short type)

Creates a new gradient morph fill style.

Shapes can be filled with different gradients in the morph's start and end state. A gradient contains several control points; the fill color is interpolated between these point's colors. Start and end gradients must have the same number of control points. Control points of start and end gradients as well as their colors are defined in a MorphGradient instance.

Gradients are defined in the gradient square: (-16384, -16384, 16384, 16384). The gradient matrix is used to map the gradient from the gradient square to the display surface. Supply gradient matrices for start and end state.

Linear and circular gradients are supported. Use either TYPE_LINEAR_GRADIENT or TYPE_CIRCULAR_GRADIENT as gradient type.

Parameters:
gradient - a morph gradient
startGradientMatrix - start gradient matrix
endGradientMatrix - end gradient matrix
type - gradient type
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified gradient type is not supported

MorphFillStyle

public MorphFillStyle(RGBA startColor,
                      RGBA endColor)
Creates a new solid morph fill style. Specify fill colors with transparency (RGBA) for start and end state.

Parameters:
startColor - start color
endColor - end color

getBitmapId

public int getBitmapId()
Returns the character ID of the bitmap used for filling. Supported only for bitmap fills.

Returns:
bitmap character ID

getEndBitmapMatrix

public Matrix getEndBitmapMatrix()
Returns the bitmap matrix used to map the bitmap to the filled shape in the end state of the morph sequence. Supported only for bitmap fills.

Returns:
end bitmap matrix

getEndColor

public RGBA getEndColor()
Returns the fill color of the shape in the end state of the morph sequence. Supported only for solid fills.

Returns:
end color

getEndGradientMatrix

public Matrix getEndGradientMatrix()
Returns the transform matrix used to map the gradient from the gradient square to the display surface in the end state of the morph sequence. Supported only for gradient fills.

Returns:
end gradient matrix

getGradient

public MorphGradient getGradient()
Returns the morph gradient used for filling. Contains gradient control points as well as their colors, both for start and end morph state. Supported only for gradient fills.

Returns:
morph gradient

getStartBitmapMatrix

public Matrix getStartBitmapMatrix()
Returns the bitmap matrix used to map the bitmap to the filled shape in the start state of the morph sequence. Supported only for bitmap fills.

Returns:
start bitmap matrix
